meanings.definition: No longer in use or no longer useful
meanings.sent1: The floppy disk is now obsolete in today's technology.
meanings.sent2: The rotary phone became obsolete with the invention of smartphones.
meanings.sent3: The typewriter felt sad being obsolete in the age of computers.
meanings.sent4: Her fashion sense was as obsolete as a VHS tape in a streaming world.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned factory stood as a monument to all things obsolete.

meanings.sent1: The cassette player is considered obsolete by most young people.
meanings.sent2: Wearing bell-bottoms is now seen as obsolete in the fashion industry.
meanings.sent3: His insistence on using a pager seemed charmingly obsolete in the smartphone era.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were as obsolete as a horse and buggy in a world of electric cars.
meanings.sent5: The dusty library was a treasure trove of obsolete knowledge.
